info.title: Search API Server
info.description:
Presents developer entrypoints to the Search API features.
Endpoints with tags marked as protected are JWT secured and need an administrator to login before usage. Use the endpoint /admin/authenticate to get a JWT token.
Copy that JWT Token and use the Authorize button on the top right corner of the Swagger UI to enter the JWT token.
Example: Bearer JWT_TOKEN
The credentials are the ones you have configured for the search administrator and push administrator during deployment.

get.summary: getContentSources with optional parameter(s) added to the endpoint with ?type=typelist and/or ?size=pagesize
get.description: This API lists available content-sources by passing content "type" (with comma separated eg. wcm,dam) and max page "size".

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: comma separated list of contentsource types (i.e. wcm,dam,jcr)

post.summary: postContentSources tries to create an OpenSearch document and index from the given name, type and aclLookupHost as parameter.
post.description: This API updates multiple but only existing documents in the content source index with given ID and returns an object having a succeeded and failed ids array.

get.summary: getContentSourcesById which returns a single content source identified by its ID
get.description: This API returns content-sources by passing a single content source ID.

post.summary: postContentSources tries to create an OpenSearch document and index from the given name, type and aclLookupHost as parameter.
post.description: This API updates multiple but only existing documents in the content source index with given ID and returns an object having a succeeded and failed ids array.

put.summary: putContentSources with a single ID, fully updates content source by accepting name, type and aclLookupHost as parameter
put.description: This API fully updates content source by accepting "name", "type" and "aclLookupHost" as parameter.

patch.summary: patchContentSources with a single ID, partially updates a content source by accepting "name", "type" and "aclLookupHost" as parameter
patch.description: This API updates content source by accepting "name", "type" and "aclLookupHost" as parameter.

delete.summary: deleteContentSources with a single ID deletes an OpenSearch document and index for the given "contentsource_id"
delete.description: This API deletes content source for the given "contentsource_id"

400.description: Unable to delete Content Source element

get.description: This API lists all content-source types.

parameters.name: showFieldMappings
parameters.description: Returns the field mappings for each type of Content Source.

get.description: This API retrieves all available Crawlers along with the "configuration"

post.description: This API creates a new crawler "configuration" for the given "contentSource" and "type"

get.description: This API retrieves "contentSource" and "type" along with the "configuration" for the given "crawler_id"

put.description: This API fully updates "contentSource", "type" and "configuration" for a given crawler by accepting "crawler_id"

patch.description: This API partially updates "contentSource", "type" and "configuration" for a given crawler by accepting "crawler_id"

delete.description: This API deletes a crawler by accepting "crawler_id"

post.description: This API verifies credentials for crawler configuration with "crawler_id"

parameters.name: clear_timestamp
parameters.description: Clear the timestamp and trigger the crawler

get.description: This API retrieves a single crawler with "contentSource" and "type" along with the "configuration" for the given "contentsource_id"

404.description: Content source id not found or no crawlers found

get.summary: Get document ids from index given as contentsource_id (getContentsourcesDocuments)
get.description: This API lists document ids from content source index with given ID.

put.summary: Update/Add multiple documents in the index given as contentsource_id (updateContentsourceDocuments)
put.description: This API updates/adds multiple documents in the content source index with given ID and returns an object having a succeeded and failed ids array.

created.description: Date of creation in original source

updated.description: Date of last update in original source

type.description: This document has details of raspberry pi

400.description: Request failed because none of provided documents were updated/added.

404.description: Document ids missing or content source ID not found.

patch.summary: Update multiple existing documents in the index given as contentsource_id (updateContentsourceDocuments)
patch.description: This API updates multiple but only existing documents in the content source index with given ID and returns an object having a succeeded and failed ids array.

created.description: Date of creation in original source

updated.description: Date of last update in original source

description.description: This document has details of raspberry pi

400.description: Request failed because none of provided documents were updated/added.

404.description: Document ids missing or or content source ID not found.

post.summary: Update/Add multiple documents to the index given as contentsource_id (postContentsourcesDocuments)
post.description: This API updates/adds multiple documents to the content source index with given ID and returns an object having a succeeded and failed ids array.

created.description: Date of creation in original source

updated.description: Date of last update in original source

description.description: This document has details of raspberry pi

dataUri.description: Path to the content that will get text extraction run

403.description: New document not created in index.

delete.summary: Delete multiple documents passed in as array from index given as contentsource_id (deleteContentsourcesDocumentsBulk)
delete.description: This API deletes multiple documents in the content source index with given ID and returns an object having a succeeded and failed ids array.

404.description: Content source id not found or none of the documents deleted.

post.summary: Get multiple documents from index given as contentsource_id (postContentsourcesDocumentsGet)
post.description: This API returns all documents from the given ID which matches the document ids passed as array in the body. Ids not found in the index are ignored and not part the response.

400.description: Wrong request body (e.g. no ids identifier or empty id list)

delete.summary: Delete multiple documents defined by query from index given as contentsource_id (deleteContentsourcesDocumentsByQuery)
delete.description: This API deletes multiple documents in the content source index with given ID if the query returned matching documents.

query.description: Query object as defined by Opensearch

404.description: Content source id not found or no documents deleted if query did not find any document.

get.summary: Get single document from index given as contentsource_id (getContentsourcesDocumentsById)
get.description: This API gets a single document from the content source index with given ID and the passed in document id.

404.description: Content source id or document not found.

post.summary: Add a single document to index given as contentsource_id (postContentsourcesDocumentsById)
post.description: This API adds a single not existing document to the content source index with given ID and returns the created document object.

created.description: Date of creation in original source

updated.description: Date of last update in original source

description.description: This document has details of raspberry pi

put.summary: Update/Add a single document to index given as contentsource_id (updateContentsourceDocuments)
put.description: This API updates/adds a single document to the content source index with given ID and returns the updated/created document object.

created.description: Date of creation in original source

updated.description: Date of last update in original source

description.description: This document has details of raspberry pi

400.description: Request failed because the of provided document was not updated/added.

404.description: Content source id not found or document id missing.

patch.summary: Update a single existing document to index given as contentsource_id (updateContentsourceDocuments)
patch.description: This API updates a single already existing document in the content source index with given ID and returns the updated document object.

created.description: Date of creation in original source

updated.description: Date of last update in original source

description.example: This document has details of raspberry pi
description.description: This document has details of raspberry pi

400.description: Request failed because the of provided document was not updated/added.

404.description: Content source id not found or document id missing.

delete.summary: Delete a single document passed as document_id from index given as contentsource_id (deleteContentsourcesDocumentsById)
delete.description: This API deletes a single document from the content source index with given ID.

404.description: Content source id or document id not found.

post.description:
This API returns documents and aggregations. 
                The query object is formed with a "must", "should" and/or "must_not" array of objects and
                an optional minimum_should_match property.
                It follows the standard OpenSearch Query structure.
                The aggregations object follows the same OpenSearch Aggregation structure.
                The page (default: 0) and pageSize (default: 100) parameters are optional.
                The scope parameter is an array of Content Source UUIDs to filter the search results.
                If the scope parameter is not provided, the search will be performed on all available Content Sources

This API returns documents and aggregations. 
                The query object is formed with a "must", "should" and/or "must_not" array of objects and
                an optional minimum_should_match property.
                It follows the standard OpenSearch Query structure.
                The aggregations object follows the same OpenSearch Aggregation structure.
                The page (default: 0) and pageSize (default: 100) parameters are optional.
                The scope parameter is an array of Content Source UUIDs to narrow down the search results.
                If the scope parameter is not provided, the search will be performed on all available Content Sources

post.summary: postGetToken generates JWT token by accepting "username" and "password" as parameter
post.description: This serves as authorization login for administrators to use protected APIs in subsequent calls.
